cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (Florida Panhandle–Alabama)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the central Florida Panhandle or southern Alabama

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi to the Florida Panhandle expected to be impacted; Keys and southern Florida mainly by rain and surf
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at Port Everglades (≤3 % chance of 34-kt winds, near-zero for 50-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor Atlantic‐side surge possible (generally ≤1–2 ft), well below 3 ft threshold.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 3–5 inches with localized higher totals; potential for urban and small–stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; increased rip-current risk from long-period swells.
